units.title: Machine-vision cell detection and capture
units.text: DisCo depends on machine-vision to actively detect cells and coordinate their capture in droplets, allowing for continuous operation and enabling free per-run scaling and serial processing of samples.
units.rationale: Describes the core detection and capture step of the protocol.

units.title: Generation of monodisperse emulsions
units.text: With all components operating in tight orchestration, we were able to generate monodisperse emulsions with high purity (Fig. 1e and Supplementary Video 2).
units.rationale: Specifies the emulsification step that produces uniform droplets.

units.title: Processing low‑input cell numbers
units.text: We processed cell numbers of between 50 and 200 cells, of which 74.9% (s.d. ±10.7%) of input cells had more than 500 unique molecular identifiers (UMIs) per cell (Fig. 1j).
units.rationale: Reports the execution of the protocol on small cell samples.

units.title: Species mixing validation experiment
units.text: We performed a species mixing experiment of human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293T and murine immortalized brown pre-adipocyte (IBA) cells.
units.rationale: Provides a concrete experimental step to assess cell capture specificity.

units.title: Particle detection and positioning
units.text: Particles are detected by a camera and are placed at the Stop point.
units.rationale: Details the visual detection and placement of particles before encapsulation.

units.title: Co‑encapsulation actuation sequence
units.text: The co-encapsulation process on the DisCo device (red, closed; green, open; light brown, dropleting pressure (partially closed)).
units.rationale: Outlines the valve states used during co‑encapsulation.

units.title: Droplet capture valve operation
units.text: The droplet capture process as observed on-chip. Valves are highlighted according to their actuation state (red, closed; green, open).
units.rationale: Describes the valve control during droplet capture.

units.title: Impedance‑based cell counting
units.text: We quantified the number of input cells using impedance measurements, which enabled accurate counting of the number of input cells as validated by microscopy (Extended Data Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: Provides a quantitative method for input cell enumeration.

units.title: Benchmarking with varying cell loads
units.text: We performed similar experiments involving 38, 125 and 215 HEK 293T cells on DisCo’s platform.
units.rationale: Shows how the protocol is tested across different cell quantities.

units.title: Microvalve flow control implementation
units.text: Implementation of Quake-style microvalves to facilitate flow control during operation; the development of a machine‑vision‑based approach utilizing subsequent image subtraction for blob detection to move particles into the target region of interest with 95.9% of particles placed in the region.
units.rationale: Explains the hardware and image‑processing steps that ensure precise particle placement.
